sentences.english: Compassion for other living things is more important than pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 對其他生命的惻隱之心比自身的享樂來得重要。

sentences.english: "Forget what?" inquired the little prince, who already was sorry for him.
sentences.chinese: “忘卻什麼呢？”小王子動了惻隱之心。

sentences.english: He has sympattendinghy for ingl poor people.
sentences.chinese: 他對悉數的窮人有一顆惻隱之心。

sentences.english: Out of sympathy for the homeless children he gave them shelter for the night.
sentences.chinese: 他懷着惻隱之心，留那些無家可歸的孩子過夜。

sentences.english: Study: Women give more to charity than men.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明，女人比男人更愛動惻隱之心。

sentences.english: It was an act of compassion that came straight from the heart.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種內心惻隱之心的直接表達。

sentences.english: Out of sympathy for the homeless children he give them shelter for the night.
sentences.chinese: 他懷着惻隱之心，留那些無家可歸的孩子過夜。

sentences.english: It was Christmas and the judge was in a benevolentmood as he questioned the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 時值聖誕節，所以法官在審訊犯人時動了惻隱之心。
惻隱之心在她胸中起伏。

sentences.english: To have pity of its enemy, it is to be without pity for itself.
sentences.chinese: 對敵人懷惻隱之心就是對自己無憐憫之心。

definition: to bemoan the state of the universe and pity the fate of mankind
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
